meanings.definition: Scholars or theologians associated with medieval universities.
meanings.sent1: The schoolmen of old spent their days studying ancient texts.
meanings.sent2: The schoolmen gathered in the library to debate philosophical ideas.
meanings.sent3: The schoolmen decided to have a medieval-themed party to honor their roots.
meanings.sent4: In the world of academia, the schoolmen were like knights of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The image of the schoolmen poring over dusty manuscripts is etched in history.

meanings.definition: Members of a group of thinkers or philosophers.
meanings.sent1: A diverse group of schoolmen came together to discuss ethics.
meanings.sent2: The schoolmen shared their differing viewpoints on the matter.
meanings.sent3: The schoolmen formed a book club to explore new ideas together.
meanings.sent4: Among the schoolmen, there was a renowned philosopher known for his wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The schoolmen's gatherings were always filled with lively debates and deep conversations.

meanings.definition: Those who engage in academic or intellectual pursuits.
meanings.sent1: The schoolmen were dedicated to expanding their knowledge through research.
meanings.sent2: Many aspiring schoolmen dreamt of making groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The schoolmen organized a trivia night to test their intellectual prowess.
meanings.sent4: To the schoolmen, the pursuit of knowledge was a lifelong passion.
meanings.sent5: The schoolmen's thirst for learning was insatiable, driving them to seek answers to the unknown.
